trans-unit.source: Terms and condition policy settings | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Terms and condition policy settings | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: You can deploy Intune terms and conditions to user groups to explain how enrollment, access to work resources, and using the Company Portal app affect devices and users.
trans-unit.target: You can deploy Intune terms and conditions to user groups to explain how enrollment, access to work resources, and using the Company Portal app affect devices and users.

trans-unit.source: Terms and condition policy settings in Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Terms and condition policy settings in Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: You can deploy Intune terms and conditions to user groups to explain how enrollment, access to work resources, and using the Company Portal app affect devices and users.
trans-unit.target: You can deploy Intune terms and conditions to user groups to explain how enrollment, access to work resources, and using the Company Portal app affect devices and users.

trans-unit.source: Users must accept the terms and conditions before they can use the Company Portal to enroll and access their work.
trans-unit.target: Users must accept the terms and conditions before they can use the Company Portal to enroll and access their work.

trans-unit.source: You can create and deploy multiple policies containing different terms and conditions.
trans-unit.target: You can create and deploy multiple policies containing different terms and conditions.

trans-unit.source: You can also produce versions of the same terms and conditions in different languages and then deploy these to their appropriate groups.
trans-unit.target: You can also produce versions of the same terms and conditions in different languages and then deploy these to their appropriate groups.

trans-unit.source: Create a terms and conditions policy
trans-unit.target: Create a terms and conditions policy

trans-unit.source: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](http://manage.microsoft.com) click **Policy** > **Terms and Conditions**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](http://manage.microsoft.com) click **Policy** > **Terms and Conditions**.

trans-unit.source: Terms and conditions policy screenshot
trans-unit.target: Terms and conditions policy screenshot

trans-unit.source: Click **Add** to create a new terms and conditions policy.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add** to create a new terms and conditions policy.

trans-unit.source: You can also **Edit** or **Delete** an existing policy.
trans-unit.target: You can also **Edit** or **Delete** an existing policy.

trans-unit.source: On the **Create Terms and Conditions** page, specify the following information:
trans-unit.target: On the **Create Terms and Conditions** page, specify the following information:

trans-unit.source: **Name** - A unique policy name displayed in the Intune console
trans-unit.target: **Name** - A unique policy name displayed in the Intune console

trans-unit.source: **Description** - Details that help you identify the policy in the Intune console
trans-unit.target: **Description** - Details that help you identify the policy in the Intune console

trans-unit.source: **Title** - The title displayed to users in the company portal
trans-unit.target: **Title** - The title displayed to users in the company portal

trans-unit.source: **Text to explain what it means if the user accepts** - Label users see regarding acceptance.
trans-unit.target: **Text to explain what it means if the user accepts** - Label users see regarding acceptance.

trans-unit.source: **Example**: “I agree to the terms and conditions.”
trans-unit.target: **Example**: “I agree to the terms and conditions.”

trans-unit.source: When you are finished, click **Save**.
trans-unit.target: When you are finished, click **Save**.

trans-unit.source: The new policy is displayed in the **Terms and Conditions** node of the **Policy** workspace.
trans-unit.target: The new policy is displayed in the **Terms and Conditions** node of the **Policy** workspace.

trans-unit.source: Deploy a terms and conditions policy
trans-unit.target: Deploy a terms and conditions policy

trans-unit.source: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](http://manage.microsoft.com) click **Policy** > **Terms and Conditions**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](http://manage.microsoft.com) click **Policy** > **Terms and Conditions**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Terms and Conditions Policies** list, select the policy you want to deploy, and then click **Manage Deployment**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Terms and Conditions Policies** list, select the policy you want to deploy, and then click **Manage Deployment**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Manage Deployment** dialog box, select the user groups who you want to deploy the policy to, and then click **OK**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Manage Deployment** dialog box, select the user groups who you want to deploy the policy to, and then click **OK**.

trans-unit.source: When targeted users access the company portal, Intune displays the terms and conditions you deployed.
trans-unit.target: When targeted users access the company portal, Intune displays the terms and conditions you deployed.

trans-unit.source: Users must accept these terms before they can gain access to company resources.
trans-unit.target: Users must accept these terms before they can gain access to company resources.

trans-unit.source: Monitor a terms and conditions policy
trans-unit.target: Monitor a terms and conditions policy

trans-unit.source: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](http://manage.microsoft.com) click **Policy** > **Terms and Conditions**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](http://manage.microsoft.com) click **Policy** > **Terms and Conditions**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Create New Report** window, click **View Report**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Create New Report** window, click **View Report**.

trans-unit.source: The report will open detailing which users have accepted the terms and conditions you deployed.
trans-unit.target: The report will open detailing which users have accepted the terms and conditions you deployed.

trans-unit.source: Updates and version control for terms and conditions
trans-unit.target: Updates and version control for terms and conditions

trans-unit.source: When you edit an existing terms and conditions policy, you can choose the behavior when you deploy the policy.
trans-unit.target: When you edit an existing terms and conditions policy, you can choose the behavior when you deploy the policy.

trans-unit.source: Use the following procedure to help you update existing terms and conditions policies.
trans-unit.target: Use the following procedure to help you update existing terms and conditions policies.

trans-unit.source: How to work with multiple versions of terms and conditions
trans-unit.target: How to work with multiple versions of terms and conditions

trans-unit.source: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](http://manage.microsoft.com) click **Policy** > **Terms and Conditions**.
trans-unit.target: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](http://manage.microsoft.com) click **Policy** > **Terms and Conditions**.

trans-unit.source: Select the terms and conditions policy that you want to edit, and then click **Edit**.
trans-unit.target: Select the terms and conditions policy that you want to edit, and then click **Edit**.

trans-unit.source: On the **Edit Terms and Conditions** page, make any required edits, and then specify whether this new version requires all users to accept the terms and conditions, or only new users will see the new version.
trans-unit.target: On the **Edit Terms and Conditions** page, make any required edits, and then specify whether this new version requires all users to accept the terms and conditions, or only new users will see the new version.

trans-unit.source: We recommend you increase the version number and require acceptance any time you make significant changes to your terms and conditions policy.
trans-unit.target: We recommend you increase the version number and require acceptance any time you make significant changes to your terms and conditions policy.

trans-unit.source: Keep the current version number if you are fixing typos or changing formatting, for example.
trans-unit.target: Keep the current version number if you are fixing typos or changing formatting, for example.

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also

trans-unit.source: Manage settings and features on your devices with Microsoft Intune policies
trans-unit.target: Manage settings and features on your devices with Microsoft Intune policies
